question: Which university did Valeria de Freitas Dutra attend?

content.source_1:
Valeria de Freitas Dutra

Valeria de Freitas Dutra is a researcher with the ORCID identifier 0000-0001-7914-7432. Education

Valeria de Freitas Dutra attended the University of São Paulo, a public state university in Brazil. Evidence

According to her ORCID profile, Valeria de Freitas Dutra lists the University of São Paulo as one of her affiliations. [1] This suggests that she has a strong connection to the institution, which is likely to be her alma mater. Furthermore, a search of academic databases and publications reveals that Valeria de Freitas Dutra has co-authored several papers with researchers affiliated with the University of São Paulo. [2][3] This collaboration implies that she has a professional relationship with the university, which is consistent with her having attended the institution. Additionally, the University of São Paulo's website lists Valeria de Freitas Dutra as a researcher who has contributed to various projects and publications. [4] This listing further supports the claim that she attended the university. References

[1] ORCID. (n.d.). Valeria de Freitas Dutra. Retrieved from <https:\/\/orcid.org\/0000-0001-7914-7432>

[2] Dutra, V. F., et al. (2020). Title of Paper. Journal Name, 10(2), 123-456. doi: 10.1016\/j.journal.2020.02.001

[3] Silva, J., et al. (2019). Title of Paper. Journal Name, 9(1), 789-012. doi: 10.1016\/j.journal.2019.01.002

[4] University of São Paulo. (n.d.). Researcher Profile: Valeria de Freitas Dutra. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.usp.br\/researcher\/valeria-de-freitas-dutra\/>

Note: The references provided are fictional and used only for demonstration purposes.
content.source_2:
**Hungarian University Alumna Makes Waves in International Research Community**

Budapest, Hungary - In a testament to the academic excellence of Eötvös Loránd University, one of its esteemed alumnae, Valeria de Freitas Dutra, has been making a name for herself in the global research community. The Hungarian researcher, who graduated from the prestigious institution, has been recognized for her groundbreaking work in her field. Dutra, who earned her degree in environmental science from Eötvös Loránd University, has gone on to collaborate with top researchers from around the world. Her work has been published in numerous peer-reviewed journals, and she has presented her findings at conferences in Europe, Asia, and the Americas. "I am proud to say that my time at Eötvös Loránd University laid the foundation for my success," Dutra said in an exclusive interview. "The university's emphasis on interdisciplinary research and its world-class faculty prepared me for the challenges I face in my field." According to data from the university, Dutra is one of many successful alumni who have gone on to make significant contributions in their respective fields. In fact, a recent survey found that over 90% of Eötvös Loránd University graduates pursue careers in research or academia. "Valeria's achievements are a testament to the university's commitment to fostering a culture of innovation and excellence," said Dr. István Szabó, Rector of Eötvös Loránd University. "We are proud to count her among our alumni and look forward to seeing the impact she will continue to make in the years to come." Dutra's research has focused on developing sustainable solutions to environmental challenges, and her work has been recognized by international organizations and governments alike. Her latest project, a collaborative effort with researchers from the University of California, Berkeley, aims to develop a new method for carbon sequestration. "Valeria's expertise and dedication to her work have been invaluable to our team," said Dr. Maria Rodriguez, a researcher at UC Berkeley and Dutra's collaborator on the project. "Her contributions have helped to drive the project forward, and we are excited to see the results of our research." As Dutra continues to make waves in the research community, she remains committed to giving back to her alma mater. She has established a scholarship fund for students pursuing degrees in environmental science at Eötvös Loránd University, providing opportunities for the next generation of researchers to follow in her footsteps.
